text: Is it possible to track a "blog view" externally via the API, i want to get tracking data in HubSpot for blog posts, but i want to create them in an external system
'so i can include external blog posts in campaign tracking etc

Hi Community,

I am looking at this endpoint here and had a quick question.Using typeform with the forms API and notice its submits the IP address from the server which the article said it would if left blank. How should this be formatted so it pulls in the contacts who is submitting email address so I can properly track analytics?
 If you include an IP Address would it use that and if you don't it would use the server IP Address?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

Should it literally look like this?

"{
    "hutk": "60c2ccdfe4892f0fa0593940b12c11aa",
    "ipAddress": "192.168.1.12",
    "pageUrl": "<http://demo.hubapi.com/contact/>",
    "pageName": "Contact Us",
    "redirectUrl": "<http://demo.hubapi.com/thank-you/>"
}    "

or

{
    "hutk": "60c2ccdfe4892f0fa0593940b12c11aa",
    "ipAddress":
    "pageUrl": "<http://demo.hubapi.com/contact/>",
    "pageName": "Contact Us",
    "redirectUrl": "<http://demo.hubapi.com/thank-you/>"
}

Hey KJ, I haven't used typeform before, but those fields are typically used like this:

you have a page on an external system, which also includes the HubSpot tracking code snippet (which then creates a cookie with a unique HubSpot user token, or hutk). Then on your page, you compile a webhook that takes user data (from a form, for example), grab the hutk and ipAddress from the HubSpot cookie, then post the webhook to the API endpoint.
This isnâ€™t supported at this time <@UG1C2U52A>
Thanks for the response though
<@UEZJ74UN8> FYI we are sunsetting IP addresses from our API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/sunset-contacts-ip-address-will-no-longer-be-accessible-via-apis>

Of course, you should post this to <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/custom/page/page-id/ideaslandingpage> so we can help our PMs gauge how many people would take advantage of this if were to add support for tracking external pages in a similar way to how we look at internally hosted pages
hello. does anyone know if it is possible get the form ID in the forms callback <https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
Hey <@UG7S8J18D> The Id of the form is returned in all of the callbacks in the doc you linked to.  Is that not working for you?
Hi Zack. what is the variable name I should use?
`id`
this is what I have so far but it says it is undefined
`console.log(event.data.id)`
in the code you have, you never assigned `id` to a value
you have to get it from the `event`
ahh thank you very much
that is awesome
Glad you like it, let me know if anything else comes up
